text: Apologetic proverbs (also known as Wellerisms), make fun of proverbs by showing that they are wrong, in some situations. They have : *a proverb (or saying ), and *an explanation (often humorous ). They often have sardonic humor. ==Examples== * A body can get used to anything, even to being hanged, as the Irishman said. (Lucy Maud Montgomery--Anne of Green Gables) Category:Phrases Category:Humor Category:Figures of speech
title: Apologetic proverb
